Altaf Mahmud was a musician, cultural activist, and martyred freedom fighter of the Bangladesh Liberation War. He was born on the 23 December, 1933. He was also a language activist of the Language Movement and composer of 'Amar Bhaier Rokte Rangano', the famous song written by Abdul Gaffar Chowdhury, a famous journalist who breathed his last in 2022. In 1950, he sang gonoshongit in many places to inspire the activists of Language Movement. Along with his-singing, Mahmud continued to support the movement. He tuned the song 'Amar Bhaier Rokte Rangano' in 1969, in Zahir Raihan's film 'Jibon Theke Neya'. Altaf Mahmud took part in the Bangladesh Liberation War in 1971. He created a secret camp inside his house for the freedom fighters. But as the secret revealed, Pakistan Army caught him. on August 30, 1971. He was tortured by them. A lot of other guerrilla war fighters like Shafi Imam Rumi were also captured by the Pak Army on that day. Along with most of them, he was lost ever since. His patriotic songs which were then broadcast at the,"Swadhin Bangla Betar Kendra" also inspired the war fighters at that time. In 1977, Altaf Mahmud was awarded the Ekushey Padak for his valuable contribution to Bengali culture and the War of Liberation.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Altaf Mahmud,' a musician, cultural and language activist and martyred freedom fighter, was born on 23 December 1933. He was the composer of the famous mourning song 'Amar Bhaier Rokte Ranigano...' In 1950, he sang gonoshongit to encourage, the activists of Language Movement. In 1971, while fighting to liberate the nation, the Pakistani army caught him and tortured him brutally. He was not found ever since. His patriotic songs used to inspire the freedom fighters during the Liberation War. Altaf Mahmud was awarded with the Ekushey Padak in 1977 for his valuable contribution to Bengali Culture and the Liberation War.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on "Price Hike" by answering the following questions:
(a) What is price hike? (b) Why does price of things increase? (c) How do people suffer for price hike? (d)How can we control it? (e) What should we do to stop it?

sub_questions.explanation:
Price Hike
Price hike means rise in prices of essential commodities. It is a common phenomenon in our country. The prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds. Indeed, price of daily commodities has gone beyond the reach of the common people. There are many causes of price hike. Insufficient supply of daily commodities is mainly responsible for price hike. Our population is increasing rapidly, but our food production is not increasing proportionately. For this, we do not get enough food in comparison to our increasing demands. Moreover, frequent natural disasters like flood, drought, cyclone, etc. hamper our food production, which accelerates the price hike of essential food items. On the other hand, hoarding is another important factor of soaring price level. Some dishonest traders devoid of morality hoard essential goods and create artificial shortage in the market. Then they sell the goods at higher price. Political unrest like strikes is also responsible for a surge in price. Lack of market supervision, black marketing and smuggling also contribute to price hike. The phenomenon has increased the suffering of the common people. The poor and the middle class are mostly affected by it. But, the worst sufferers of it are those who live from hand to mouth. They find it hard to feed their family members. Some of them remain half- fed. As a result, they suffer from malnutrition. Unusual price hike hampers the economic balance of a country. The government should take effective steps to tackle the situation, most notably by increasing food production. Each and every shop must have a price chart fixed by the government. The law enforcing agencies should be deployed in the market places to monitor the market price, Legal actions must be taken against the dishonest businessmen and hoarders. Actually, people of all walks of life should also co- operate with the government.

During load shedding I would like to go on my terrace to enjoy fresh air specially at night. Last night at 12:30 am when the electricity went off for a long time, I decided to spend some time on the terrace. I went there and after some time, I felt like someone was following me though I could not see anyone and a cold sweating grasped me. I.......:

sub_questions.explanation:
Pranks Are Not Always Fun
Load shedding is a common phenomenon in Bangladesh. During load shedding I would like to go on my terrace to enjoy fresh air specially at night. Last night, at 12:30 am when the electricity went off for a long time, I decided to spend some time on the terrace. I went there and after some time, I felt like someone was following me though I could not see anyone and a cold sweating grasped me. I got frightened when my phone rang. It was an unknown number. I thought it might be an emergency or something scary to me. My father was out on an official tour and suddenly it came to my mind that something might have happened to him. I received the call and asked who it was. No one replied but I heard that someone heaved a deep sigh.
It made me more scared and I repeated the same question. But the result was same; no one replied. After six or seven minutes, suddenly someone burst into laughter and hung up the phone. I was utterly horrified and confused. That incident made me so disturbed that I couldn't even concentrate on my studies anymore after coming downstairs. The next day, after finishing the exam, I came across a neighbour who revealed that he played a prank on me last night. He was just walking a little far from me on the opposite section of terrace and was trying to frighten me. I was so shocked that I asked for a reasonable answer. He told that he loved to play pranks on others but he meant no harm. I advised him not to do that again. All of us must be careful about our actions and shouldn't do anything which hampers the peace of others' minds.

About the environmental hazards and threatning effect of climate change in Bangladeshi people's life.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions.

a. Why can humans neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun?

b. Describe how human beings are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

c. What do you think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is?

d. Why enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year? Describe in brief.

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Humans can neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun, because these things are beyond their control.

(b) Human beings do some unwise activities like burning too much fossil fuels, setting up more factories, cutting down trees indiscriminately, etc. that result in the increase of greenhouse gases. Thus, they are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

(c) I think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is the burning of fossil fuels. With the increase of industrial activities, the combustion of coal has increased. Besides coal, mineral oil and natural gas are also burned for various purposes. Thus, every time a fossil raw material is burned, it releases carbon dioxide into the air.

(d) Enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year to obtain wood and to clear regions for mining and to create pasture.
